DescribeRegions.summary: Queries the Alibaba Cloud regions that are supported by ActionTrail.

schema.description:
The language in which the region names are returned. Valid values:

- zh-CN: Chinese.
- en-US: English. It is the default value.

RegionEndpoint.title: 地域链接地址
RegionEndpoint.description: The endpoint of ActionTrail in the region.

LocalName.title: 地域名称
LocalName.description:
The name of the region.

> If the AcceptLanguage parameter is set to zh-CN, the Chinese name of the region is returned. If the AcceptLanguage parameter is set to zh-US or left empty, the English name of the region is returned.

DescribeRegions.title: DescribeRegions
DescribeRegions.description: For more information, see [Regions and zones](~~40654~~).
DescribeRegions.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

CreateTrail.summary: By default, ActionTrail allows you to query events that are generated within your Alibaba Cloud account in the last 90 days. To query and analyze events that are generated more than 90 days ago, you can create a trail to deliver events to Object Storage Service (OSS), Simple Log Service, or MaxCompute.

schema.description:
The name of the trail to be created.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_).

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.

The name of the OSS bucket to which events are to be delivered.

The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter or a digit and can contain lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

> You must specify at least one of the OssBucketName and SlsProjectArn parameters.

The prefix of the log files to be stored in the destination OSS bucket. This parameter can be left empty.

The prefix must be 6 to 32 characters in length. The prefix must start with a letter and can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), forward slashes (/), and underscores (\_).

The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the required resources. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).

The ARN of the Log Service project to which events are to be delivered.

> You must specify at least one of the OssBucketName and SlsProjectArn parameters.

The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the Log Service project.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the corresponding resource. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).

The read/write type of the events to be delivered. Valid values:

*   Write: write events. It is the default value.
*   Read: read events.
*   All: read and write events.

The one or more regions from which the trail delivers events.

The default value is All, which indicates that the trail delivers events from all regions.

You can also specify specific regions. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~213597~~) operation to query all the supported regions.

Specifies whether to create a multi-account trail. Valid values:

*   true: creates a multi-account trail.
*   false (default): creates a single-account trail.

SlsProjectArn.description: The ARN of the Log Service project to which events are to be delivered.

OssWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the destination OSS bucket.

EventRW.description: The read/write type of the events to be delivered.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

OssKeyPrefix.description: The prefix of the log files to be stored in the destination OSS bucket.

OssBucketName.description: The name of the OSS bucket to which events are to be delivered.

SlsWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the destination Log Service project.

TrailRegion.description: The one or more regions from which the trail delivers events.

400.errorMessage: You must specify at least one Log Service project or OSS bucket for a Trail.
The specified OSS bucket prefix is invalid.
The specified query parameter is invalid.
The specified Trail name is invalid.
The specified OSS bucket is already in use. We recommend that you modify the existing Trail or specify another bucket.
The specified Log Service project does not exist.
The specified Trail name already exists.
Your account can create only one organization trail.
Your account does not allow you to create organization trail. Submit a ticket to get customer support.

403.errorMessage: Access to the specified OSS bucket was denied.
Access to the specified Log Service project was denied.
The number of Trails in the same region exceeds the upper limit (5).

404.errorMessage: The specified OSS bucket does not exist.

CreateTrail.title: CreateTrail
CreateTrail.description:
You can create a trail to deliver events to Log Service, Object Storage Service (OSS), or both. Before you call this operation to create a trail, make sure that the following requirements are met:

*   Deliver events to Log Service: A project is created in Log Service.

**

**Description** After you create a trail to deliver events to Log Service, a Logstore whose name is in the `actiontrail_<Trail name>` format is automatically created and optimally configured for subsequent auditing. Indexes and a dashboard are created for the Logstore to facilitate event queries. You cannot manually write data to the Logstore. This ensures data accuracy. You do not need to create a Logstore in advance.

*   Deliver events to OSS: A bucket is created in OSS. This topic provides an example on how to call the API operation to create a single-account trail named `trail-test` to deliver events to an OSS bucket named `audit-log`.
CreateTrail.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description:
The name of the trail that you want to delete.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_).

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.
test

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

DeleteTrail.title: DeleteTrail
DeleteTrail.description: This topic describes how to delete a sample trail named `trail-test`.
DeleteTrail.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

StartLogging.summary: Enables a trail to deliver events to an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket or a Log Service Logstore.

schema.description:
The name of the trail that you want to enable.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length, and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). It must start with a lowercase letter.

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

StartLogging.title: StartLogging
StartLogging.description: This topic describes how to enable logging for a sample trail named `trail-test`.
StartLogging.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

UpdateTrail.summary: Updates the configurations of a trail.

schema.description:
The name of the trail whose configurations you want to update.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). It must start with a lowercase letter.

>  The name must be unique within an Alibaba Cloud account.

The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket to which you want to deliver events.

The name must be 3 to 63 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter or a digit and can contain lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens (-).

>  Make sure that the bucket exists before you update the configuration of the trail.

The prefix of the files that are stored in the OSS bucket.

The prefix must be 6 to 32 characters in length. The prefix must start with a letter and can contain letters, digits, hyphens (-), forward slashes (/), and underscores (\_).

The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the required resources. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).
The ARN of the Log Service project to which you want to deliver events.

The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the Log Service project.

*   If you do not specify this parameter, ActionTrail creates a service-linked role to create the corresponding resource. For more information, see [Manage the service-linked role](~~169244~~).
*   If you specify this parameter, you must grant the permissions of the service-linked role that is assumed by ActionTrail to the RAM role before you can deliver events to your Alibaba Cloud account. If you need to deliver events to other Alibaba Cloud accounts, you must attach the permission policy that is used to grant permissions related to event delivery to the RAM role. For more information about how to deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts, see [Deliver events across Alibaba Cloud accounts](~~207462~~).

The read/write type of the events to be delivered. Valid values:

*   Write: write events. It is the default value.
*   Read: read events.
*   All: read and write events.

The region of the trail.

*   The default value is All, which indicates that the trail delivers events from all regions.

You can also specify specific regions. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~213597~~) operation to query all the supported regions.

SlsProjectArn.description: The ARN of the Log Service project to which events are to be delivered.

OssWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

EventRW.description: The read/write type of the events to be delivered.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

OssKeyPrefix.description: The prefix of the log files to be stored in the destination OSS bucket.

OssBucketName.description: The name of the OSS bucket.

SlsWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail is to deliver events to the Log Service project.

TrailRegion.description: The one or more regions from which the trail delivers events.

400.errorMessage: The specified OSS bucket is already in use. We recommend that you modify the existing Trail or specify another bucket.
The specified Log Service project does not exist.
The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
You must specify at least one Log Service project or OSS bucket for a Trail.
The specified OSS bucket prefix is invalid.

403.errorMessage: Access to the specified OSS bucket was denied.
Access to the specified Log Service project was denied.

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.
The specified OSS bucket does not exist.

UpdateTrail.description: This topic shows you how to change the destination Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket of a sample trail named `trail-test` to `audit-log`.

StopLogging.summary: Disables a trail to stop the delivery of events to an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket or a Log Service Logstore.

schema.description:
The name of the trail that you want to disable.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length, and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_). It must start with a lowercase letter.

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

StopLogging.title: StopLogging
StopLogging.description: This topic describes how to disable logging for a sample trail named `trail-test`.

GetTrailStatus.summary: Queries the status of a trail.

schema.description:
The name of the trail.

The name must be 6 to 36 characters in length. The name must start with a lowercase letter and can contain lowercase letters, digits, hyphens (-), and underscores (\_).

> The name must be unique within your Alibaba Cloud account.

Specifies whether to query the status of a multi-account trail. Valid values:

*   true: Query the status of a multi-account trail.
*   false: Query the status of a single-account trail. It is the default value.

StartLoggingTime.description: The time when logging was last enabled for the trail.

LatestDeliveryError.description: The log of the last failed delivery.
LatestDeliveryError.example: write sls failed, exception: the parent of sub user must be project owner, itemscount: 1

StopLoggingTime.description: The time when logging was last disabled for the trail.

IsLogging.description:
Indicates whether logging is enabled for the trail. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

LatestDeliveryTime.description: The most recent time when an event was delivered by the trail.

LatestDeliveryLogServiceError.description: The log of the last failed delivery to Log Service.
LatestDeliveryLogServiceError.example: write sls failed, exception: the parent of sub user must be project owner, itemscount: 1

LatestDeliveryLogServiceTime.description: The most recent time when an event was delivered to Log Service.

OssBucketStatus.description:
Indicates whether the destination Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket is available. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

SlsLogStoreStatus.description:
Indicates whether the destination Log Service Logstore is available. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

GetTrailStatus.description: This topic describes how to query the status of a sample single-account trail named `trail-test`.

schema.description:
Specifies whether to return the information about shadow trails. Valid values:

*   false: Do not return the information about shadow trails. It is the default value.
*   true: Return the information about shadow trails.
The names of the trails whose information you want to query. Separate multiple trail names with commas (,).

Specifies whether to query the information about multi-account trails. Valid values:

*   true
*   false (default)

Status.description:
The status of the trail. Valid values:

*   Disable: disabled.
*   Enable: enabled.
*   Fresh: The trail is created but is not enabled.

UpdateTime.description: The time when the configurations of the trail were last updated.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

CreateTime.description: The time when the trail was created.

OssKeyPrefix.description: The prefix of the files that are stored in the Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket.

EventRW.description:
The read/write type of the events that are delivered. Valid values:

*   Write: write events. This is the default value.
*   Read: read events.
*   All: read and write events.

StartLoggingTime.description: The time when the trail was last enabled.

OssWriteRoleArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the OSS bucket.

SlsProjectArn.description: The ARN of the Log Service project to which events are delivered.

IsOrganizationTrail.description:
Indicates whether the trail is a multi-account trail. Valid values:

*   false (default)
*   true

SlsWriteRoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role that is assumed by ActionTrail to deliver events to the Log Service project.

StopLoggingTime.description: The time when the trail was last disabled.

OssBucketName.description: The name of the OSS bucket to which events are delivered.

Region.description: The region where the trail resides.

OrganizationId.description:
The ID of the resource directory.

>  This parameter is returned only when the trail is a multi-account trail.

The specified query parameter is invalid.

DescribeTrails.title: DescribeTrails
DescribeTrails.description: This topic shows you how to query the information about the single-account trails within an Alibaba Cloud account. In this example, the information about a trail named `test-4` is returned.
DescribeTrails.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description:
The token used to request the next page of query results.

> The request parameters must be the same as those of the last request.

The maximum number of entries to be returned.

Valid values: 0 to 50.

The beginning of the time range to query. The default time is seven days prior to the current time. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ` format. The time must be in UTC.
The end of the time range to query. The default time is the current time. Specify the time in the ISO 8601 standard in the `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ` format. The time must be in UTC.

The order in which details of events are to be retrieved. Valid values:

*   FORWARD: ascending order.
*   BACKWARD: descending order. This is the default value.
Query conditions.

Key.description:
The key of the query condition. Valid values:

*  ServiceName: the name of a specific Alibaba Cloud service.
*  EventName: the name of a specific event.
*  User: the name of the RAM user who calls a specific operation.
*  EventId: the ID of a specific event.
*  ResourceType: the type of resources.
*   ResourceName: the name of a specific resource.
*   EventRW: the read/write type of events.
*  EventAccessKeyId: the AccessKey ID used in events.

> You can use only one query condition for each query.

Value.description:
The value of the query condition. Valid values:

*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to ServiceName, you can set this parameter to a value such as `Ecs`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to EventName, you can set this parameter to a value such as `ConsoleSignin`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to User, you can set this parameter to a value such as `Alice`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to EventId, you can set this parameter to a value such as `B702AFA3-FD4B-40E3-88E4-C0752FAA****`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to ResourceType, you can set this parameter to a value such as `ACS::ECS::Instance`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to ResourceName, you can set this parameter to a value such as `i-bp14664y88udkt45****`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to EventRW, you can set this parameter to `Read` or `Write`.
*   When the LookupAttribute.N.Key parameter is set to EventAccessKeyId, you can set this parameter to a value such as `LTAI4FoDkCf4DU1bic1V****`.

EndTime.description: The end of the time range when event details were queried.

NextToken.description:
The token used to return the next page of query results.

> This parameter is not returned if no more results are to be returned.

Events.description:
The returned event details.

For more information about the fields in an event log, see [ActionTrail event log reference](~~28819~~).

StartTime.description: The beginning of the time range when event details were queried.

schema.description: test

400.errorMessage: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
The end time must be later than the start time.
The specified query parameter is invalid.
The specified EndTime is invalid.
The specified StartTime is invalid.

LookupEvents.title: LookupEvents
LookupEvents.description:
When you call this operation to query event details, you can query the event details at most twice per second.

> Do not frequently call this operation. You can create a trail to deliver events to Log Service. Then, you can query event details in near real time by using the real-time log consumption feature of Log Service. For more information, see [Create a single-account trail](~~28810~~), [Create a multi-account trail](~~160661~~), and [Overview](~~28997~~).
LookupEvents.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description: The name of the trail for which you want to create a historical event delivery task.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests.

The token can contain only ASCII characters and can be up to 64 characters in length.

For more information, see [How to ensure idempotence](~~25693~~).

JobId.description: The ID of the historical event delivery task.

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.title: CreateDeliveryHistoryJob
CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.description:
Take note of the following limits:

- You must have created and configured a single-account trail to deliver events to Log Service by calling the [CreateTrail](~~212313~~) operation.
- Only one historical event delivery task can be running at a time within an Alibaba Cloud account.

This topic shows you how to create a historical event delivery task for a sample trail named `trail-name`.
CreateDeliveryHistoryJob.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description:
The ID of the historical event delivery task to be deleted.

You can call the [ListDeliveryHistoryJobs](~~188101~~) operation to query task IDs.
test

503.errorMessage: The service is unavailable. Please try again later.

DeleteDeliveryHistoryJob.title: DeleteDeliveryHistoryJob
DeleteDeliveryHistoryJob.description: This topic describes how to delete a sample historical event delivery task whose ID is `16602`.
DeleteDeliveryHistoryJob.requestParamsDescription: For more information about common request parameters, see [Common parameters](~~185885~~).

schema.description:
The number of entries per page.

*   Valid values: 1 to 100.
*   Default value: 20.

The page number.

*   Pages start from page 1.
*   Default value: 1.

TotalCount.description: The number of historical event delivery tasks returned.

PageSize.description: The number of entries per page.

PageNumber.description: The page number of the returned page.

DeliveryHistoryJobs.description: The list of historical event delivery tasks.

EndTime.description: The time when the task ended.

StartTime.description: The time when the task started.

JobStatus.description:
The task status. Valid values:

*   0: The task is initializing.
*   1: The task is delivering historical events.
*   2: The task is complete.
*   3: The task fails.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

UpdatedTime.description: The time when the task was updated.

CreatedTime.description: The time when the task was created.

503.errorMessage: The service is unavailable. Please try again later.

ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.title: ListDeliveryHistoryJobs
ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.summary: Queries a list of data backfill tasks.
ListDeliveryHistoryJobs.description: This topic describes how to query the historical event delivery tasks created within your Alibaba Cloud account. In this example, a historical event delivery task whose ID is `16602` is returned. This task is used to deliver historical events for the trail named `trail-name` to Log Service.

schema.description: The ID of the historical event delivery task.

JobStatus.description:
The task status. Valid values:

*   0: The task is initializing.
*   1: The task is delivering historical events.
*   2: The task is complete.
*   3: The task fails.

Status.description: A list of task statuses in each region.

The task status in each region. Valid values:

*   0: The task is initializing.
*   1: The task is delivering historical events.
*   2: The task is complete.
*   3: The task fails.

CreatedTime.description: The time when the task was created.

EndTime.description: The time when the task ended.

StartTime.description: The time when the task started.

TrailName.description: The name of the trail based on which the task delivers events.

UpdatedTime.description: The time when the task was updated.

HomeRegion.description: The home region of the trail.

404.errorMessage: The specified Trail does not exist.

GetDeliveryHistoryJob.title: GetDeliveryHistoryJob
GetDeliveryHistoryJob.summary: Queries the details of a data backfill task.
GetDeliveryHistoryJob.description: This topic describes how to query the details of a historical event delivery tasks created within your Alibaba Cloud account. In this example, the details of a historical event delivery task whose ID is `16602` are returned. The sample response shows that this task is used to deliver the historical events recorded by the trail named `trail-name` to Log Service and the task is complete.

schema.description: The AccessKey ID.
The Alibaba Cloud service. For more information about the Alibaba Cloud services supported by ActionTrail, see [Supported Alibaba Cloud services](~~28829~~).

The token that determines the start point of the query.

> The request parameters must be the same as those of the last request.

The number of entries to return on each page.

Valid values: 0 to 100.

Default value: 20.

UsedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the event was generated.

Detail.description: An array that consists of the details about the event.

NextToken.description: The token that determines the start point of the query.

400.errorMessage: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
The specified query parameter is invalid.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents
GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.summary: Queries the information about the most recent events that are generated when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedEvents.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about the most recent events that are generated within 400 days after February 1, 2022 when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services. For more information about supported events, see [Alibaba Cloud services and events that are supported by the AccessKey pair audit feature](~~419214~~). Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

schema.description: The AccessKey secret.

AccountId.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

UserName.description:
The name of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

If the value of the AccountType parameter is root-account, the value of the UserName parameter is root. If the value of the AccountType parameter is ram-user, the value of the UserName parameter is the name of a RAM user.

AccountType.description: The type of the account to which the AccessKey pair belongs.

UsedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the AccessKey pair was last called.

ServiceName.description: The Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

ServiceNameCn.description: The Chinese name of the Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

ServiceNameEn.description: The English name of the Alibaba Cloud service that was last accessed.

400.errorMessage: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
The specified query parameter is invalid.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo
GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.summary: Queries the information about the most recent call of a specified AccessKey pair.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedInfo.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about the most recent call of a specified AccessKey pair within 400 days after February 1, 2022. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

schema.description: The AccessKey ID.
The Alibaba Cloud service. For more information about the Alibaba Cloud services supported by ActionTrail, see [Supported Alibaba Cloud services](~~28829~~).

The token that determines the start point of the query.

> The request parameters must be the same as those of the last request.

The number of entries to return on each page.

Valid values: 0 to 100.

Default value: 20.

Ips.description: The list of returned IP addresses.

UsedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the IP address was used.

Detail.description: An array that consists of the details about the event.

NextToken.description: The token that determines the start point of the query.

400.errorMessage: The request signature does not conform to Alibaba Cloud standards.
The specified query parameter is invalid.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedIps.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedIps
GetAccessKeyLastUsedIps.summary: Queries the information about the IP addresses that are most recently used when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedIps.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about the IP addresses that are most recently used within 400 days after February 1, 2022 when a specified AccessKey pair is called to access Alibaba Cloud services. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

schema.description: The AccessKey ID.

Products.description: The list of returned Alibaba Cloud services.

UsedTimestamp.description: A pagination token. It can be used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results. Unit: millisecond.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts
GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.summary: Queries the information about the Alibaba Cloud services that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedProducts.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about Alibaba Cloud services that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair within 400 days after February 1, 2022. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

schema.description: The AccessKey ID.
The Alibaba Cloud service. For more information about the Alibaba Cloud services supported by ActionTrail, see [Supported Alibaba Cloud services](~~28829~~).

The pagination token that is used in the next request to retrieve a new page of results.

> The request parameters must be the same as those of the last request.

The number of entries per page.

*   Valid values: 0 to 100.
*   Default value: 20.

GetAccessKeyLastUsedResources.title: GetAccessKeyLastUsedResources
GetAccessKeyLastUsedResources.summary: Queries the information about the resources that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair.
GetAccessKeyLastUsedResources.description: You can call this operation to query only the information about resources that are most recently accessed by using a specified AccessKey pair within 400 days after February 1, 2022. Data is updated at 1-hour intervals, which can cause query latency. We recommend that you do not change an AccessKey pair unless required.

GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion.title: GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion
GetGlobalEventsStorageRegion.description:
By default, global events are stored in the Singapore region.

To obtain the permissions to call the API operation, you must submit a ticket.

UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion.title: UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion
UpdateGlobalEventsStorageRegion.description:
By default, global events are stored in the Singapore region.

*   To obtain the permissions to call the API operation, you must submit a ticket.
*   Only the China (Hangzhou) region (cn-hangzhou) and the Singapore region (ap-southeast-1) are supported.

schema.description:
The type of the Insights event. Valid values:

*   IpInsight: Insights event on IP address
*   ApiCallRateInsight: Insights event on API call rate
*   ApiErrorRateInsight: Insights event on API error rate

400.errorMessage: The input insightType is not available
